item.title: Counseling Center Announces Drop-in Counseling Hours for Fall 2025
item.description: The RPI Counseling Center invites students to meet with a counselor without a formal appointment, during designated drop-in hours. There are two hours available for walk-in each day (M/F - 10 a.m. to 12 p.m.; T/W/Th - 2 to 4 p.m.). Drop-in counseling is available on a first come, first served basis on days when classes are in session. Students who cannot attend drop-in times can call (518) 276-6479 to schedule an appointment.

item.title: iEAR Presents: Visiting Critic Lane Relyea | Sept. 10
item.description: Visiting Critic Lane Relyea will give a lecture titled “Friendship, Community and Other Neoliberal Propaganda in Recent Art and Culture”. Lane Relyea is Associate Professor of Art Theory and Practice at Northwestern University. His essays and reviews have appeared in such magazines as Artforum, Afterall, Art in America, Flash Art, Frieze, Parkett, Modern Painters and Texte zur Kunst. Join us in the CBIS Auditorium at 5pm on Wednesday, September 10.

item.title: “R for Python (and other…) Muggles!” RPIrates Monthly Meeting (Weds, 10 Sep, 6p, AE217)
item.description: RPIrates: The RPI R Users Group kicks off the Fall 2025 term with a review of R fundamentals useful for experienced R users but especially new users who may already have done data science on platforms such as Python. In this session we’ll focus on R data structures, subsetting, control structures, functions and vectorization. RPIrates is led by Dr. John S. Erickson, Director of Research Operations with the Rensselaer FOCI and Chief Instigator of RPIrates. Pizza and salad starts at 5:30p

item.title: EMPAC Multimedia Performance: Will Not Be Composed
item.description: October 20-24, 2025 We Will Not Be Composed is a multimedia performance created in collaboration with saxophonist and composer Stevie Manning, author and activist Soraya Chemaly, and new media artist Xuan to challenge perceptions of women’s anger in America. Manning and an ensemble of musicians build and rehearse the world premiere performance of the work utilizing the advanced spatial audio, video, and stage technologies of EMPAC Studio 1—Goodman.

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Seminar – “Assigning Learning in Percipio: A Guide for Supervisors”
item.description: This course provides supervisors with a step-by-step overview of how to assign learning content to employees using Percipio. You’ll learn how to search for relevant courses, create and manage assignments, track completion, and support your team’s development goals. Designed to be quick and practical, this session equips you with the tools needed to guide your team’s learning journey effectively.

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Seminar: “Supervisory Essentials”
item.description:
In this seminar, Managers and Supervisors will learn from each other and our Facilitators about important topics such as the Employee Value Proposition and Employee Experience, the six fundamental Leadership competencies at Rensselaer, and experience a “day in the life” of a Supervisor. In addition, the importance of managing employee performance, providing both rewards and recognition, employment law fundamentals and tools for building team capacity will be explored.
